page.title: 06The Ellesmere Centre
page.content: The Ellesmere Centre,finished last year,is named after Lord Ellesmere,now the Duke of Sutherland,who built the original village hall which now forms part of the Centre.In the Centre there is a community shop selling all sorts of groceries.It is open most weekdays from 9am to 4.30pm .Also in the Ellesmere Centre is a squash area.You can go upstairs on to a balcony and watch squash.On the balcony there is a pool table.You can see down into the big hall where you can do sports like tennis,badminton and football. football.Jumble sales,discos and parties are also held there.Many local clubs and societies meet there.Outside there is a big playing field and car park.Inside they have toilets and changing rooms with showers,a kitchen and a telephone.
